III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
South Bluff Teaching Family Home, 1005 Silver Creek Rd., Marquette, MI 49855 is a
new facility built as a residential treatment center. The construction was completed in
September 2009.
South Bluff is located on a forty acre wooded area located in Sands Township at the
end of Silver Creek Road; Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan officially acquired
the property in January 2003. The land contains an existing building and garage known
as the Old Honor Camp, which was part of the state prison system. The Old Honor
Camp building has been renovated to become the administrative offices, counseling
center, classrooms, and a community family education and support center. South Bluff
is the fourth resident treatment center constructed by Teaching Family Homes of Upper
Michigan on this forty-acre campus.
The facility has two levels, which are approximately 2,600 square foot. South Bluff
Teaching Family Home is handicap accessible. The facility has two wings intended for 4
residents on each wing with office, kitchen, open dining area, open living room area,
and a television room with French doors in the center of the building.
The lower level has a recreation room area, which is about 869 square feet minus a
stairway. There is a live-in family teacher’s apartment of about 1200 square feet that
has two bedrooms, kitchen/living room area and a full bath.
2

The facility has six resident bedrooms as follows:
Bedroom 1 (located at the northwest corner, intended for 2 residents) is 163.668 square
feet.
Bedroom 2 (located at the southwest corner, intended for 1 resident) is 86.650 square
feet.
Bedroom 3 (located next to Bedroom 2 toward the kitchen area, intended for 1 resident)
is 87.009 square feet.
Bedroom 4 (located at the northeast corner, intended for 2 residents) is 158.413 square
feet.
Bedroom 5 (located at the southeast corner, intended for 1 resident) is 87.278 square
feet.
Bedroom 6 (located next to Bedroom 5 toward the kitchen area, intended for 1 resident)
is 86.559 square feet.
Each wing has a full bathroom and the lower level has a half bath off the recreation
area.
B. Program Description
Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan currently has five Child Caring Institution
active licenses. A written request has been received to close CI210201411, also named
South Bluff Teaching Family Home when the “new” South Bluff Teaching Family Home
in licensed. The original South Bluff is located in Gladstone. The plan is to have the
current South Bluff residents move from Gladstone to Marquette when the new facility is
licensed.
This proposed Child Caring Institution will be an eight bed open residential treatment
facility (which is an increase from the six beds CI210201411 facility in Gladstone).
The program is based on the cognitive/behavioral principles and the Girls and Boys
Town Psycho Educational Model.
The new South Bluff Teaching Family Home will continue to use the Gwinn Public
Schools.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility has established compliance with all the licensing rules that can be measured
before approval of a new license, and has established intent to comply with all licensing
rules that can only be measured after the approval of a provisional license. “A” ratings
3

with no noncompliance are documented in the Fire Safety Inspection Report with the
date of inspection of 09/28/2009 and the Environmental Health Inspection Report, with
the date of inspection of 09/28/2009. Zoning Approval was received by Licensing in a
approval form dated 02/20/2009 from the Zoning Administrator of Sands Township.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original provisional six-month license to this Child
Caring Institution, Private.
